official-title.#text: To adjust the boundary of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park to include the Wallis House and Harriston Hill, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on June 26, 1935. Prior to 1935, parts of the park had been acquired and protected by Civil War veterans and the War Department.

text.#text: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park was authorized as a unit of the
Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park protects Kennesaw Mountain and Kolb’s Farm, which are battle sites along the route of General Sherman’s 1864 campaign to take Atlanta.

Most of the park protects Confederate positions and strategy. The Wallis House is one of the few original structures remaining from the Battle of Kennesaw Mountain associated with Union positions and strategy.
The Wallis House is strategically located next to a Union signal station at Harriston Hill.

quote.#tail: , and generally depicted on the map titled

quote.#text: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park, Proposed Boundary Adjustment

text.#text: The boundary of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park is modified to include the approximately 8 acres identified as
The map referred to in subsection (a) shall be on file and available for inspection in the appropriate offices of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is authorized to acquire, from willing owners only, land or interests in land described in subsection (a) by donation or exchange.
shall administer land and interests in land acquired under this section as part of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

text.#text: No non-Federal property may be included in the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park without the written consent of the owner. This provision shall apply only to those portions of the Park added under subsection (a).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not acquire by condemnation any land or interests in land under this Act or for the purposes of this Act.

text.#text: Nothing in this Act, the establishment of the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park, or the management plan for the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park shall be construed to create buffer zones outside of the Park. That activities or uses can be seen, heard, or detected from areas within the Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park shall not preclude, limit, control, regulate or determine the conduct or management of activities or uses outside the Park.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5003 RH: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act of 2014
